items.text: To the chief Musician upon Neginah, A Psalm of David.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician upon Neginah, A Psalm of David.

items.text: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
items.plainText: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.

items.text: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
items.plainText: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

items.text: For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.
items.plainText: For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.

items.text: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
items.plainText: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.

items.text: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.
items.plainText: For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.

items.text: Thou wilt prolong the king's life: and his years as many generations.
items.plainText: Thou wilt prolong the king's life: and his years as many generations.

items.text: He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.
items.plainText: He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.

items.text: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.
items.plainText: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.
